org.apache.ecs
Interface FormEvents

All Known Implementing Classes:
Option, Form, TextArea, Select, OptGroup, Input, option, textarea, select, optgroup, form, input
public interface FormEvents

This interface is intended to be implemented by elements that require javascript form event attributes.

Version:
$Id: FormEvents.java,v 1.3 2003/04/27 09:43:57 rdonkin Exp $
Author:
Stephan Nagy, Jon S. Stevens

Method Summary
 void setOnChange(java.lang.String script)
          make sure implementing classes have a setOnChange method.
 void setOnReset(java.lang.String script)
          make sure implementing classes have a setOnReset method.
 void setOnSelect(java.lang.String script)
          make sure implementing classes have a setOnSelect method.

          make sure implementing classes have a setOnSubmit method.
 

Method Detail

setOnSubmit

public void setOnSubmit(java.lang.String script)
make sure implementing classes have a setOnSubmit method. The onsubmit event occurs when a form is submitted. It only applies to the FORM element.

setOnReset

public void setOnReset(java.lang.String script)
make sure implementing classes have a setOnReset method. The onreset event occurs when a form is reset. It only applies to the FORM element.

setOnSelect

public void setOnSelect(java.lang.String script)
make sure implementing classes have a setOnSelect method. The onselect event occurs when a user selects some text in a text field. This attribute may be used with the INPUT and TEXTAREA elements.

setOnChange

public void setOnChange(java.lang.String script)
make sure implementing classes have a setOnChange method. The onchange event occurs when a control loses the input focus and its value has been modified since gaining focus. This attribute applies to the following elements: INPUT, SELECT, and TEXTAREA.
